title: Israel war : Gaza should have been reduced to ashes , says Moshe Feiglin , far - right Zehut party leader
message:
“It’s disgraceful that the AJA platforms figures like Feiglin,” the council’s executive officer, Sarah Schwartz, said.
When asked whether his comments would make life more difficult for Jewish people living in Australia, Feiglin was unapologetic.
In contemporary terms, it means abandoning the Oslo Accords and the establishment of a sovereign Palestine state and annexing occupied territories seized in 1967 during the Six Day War – Gaza, the West Bank and the Golan Heights.
Finance Minister Smotrich has also called for the return of Jewish settlements in Gaza.
“After what happened in October, there was a heightened sense of fear among Jews in Australia about what that will mean for them,” he said.
event_breakdown:
1. On January 6, 2022, shots were fired at a synagogue in Halle an der Saale, Germany.
2. On December 24, 2021, an antisemitic attack took place at a Christmas market in Strasbourg, France, where the suspect allegedly yelled antisemitic slurs and made a Nazi salute.

title: What Rep . Becca Balint learned from her family Holocaust history
message:
Like many descendants of Holocaust survivors, Becca Balint can’t pinpoint the first time she learned about her family’s story, but it’s something she’s carried with her throughout her life.
And last fall she became the first Jewish member of Congress to call for a cease-fire to end Israel’s war in Gaza.
Balint’s grandfather was killed in the Mauthausen concentration camp in Austria toward the end of the war.
Holocaust experiences in a family impact generations within that family,” Balint said.
Her family’s history in the Holocaust is often on her mind.
event_breakdown:
List the current events of antisemitism reported in text that can be placed on a map.
* In New York City on May 21, 2021, a man was arrested after allegedly attacking Jewish diners with a glass bottle, hitting one diner on the head, and kicking another.
* In Los Angeles on May 19, 2021, a synagogue was vandalized with antisemitic graffiti.
* On May 19, 2021, in Philadelphia, a Jewish man was verbally harassed and physically assaulted while walking to his synagogue.
* On May 17, 2021, in Paris, a synagogue was vandalized with antisemitic graffiti, including a swastika and the words “death to the Jews.”
* On May 16, 2021, in Berlin, a synagogue was vandalized with antisemitic graffiti, including the words “Judah murder.”
* On May 15, 2021, in London, a synagogue was vandalized with antisemitic graffiti.

title: NYC college officials attended anti - Israel lecture school slammed as  abhorrent
message:
Multiple officials from Queens College in New York City attended an anti-Israel lecture in February despite the school president warning the speaker holds "abhorrent" views.
A Queens College student club invited Daniel Haqiqatjou, who has a history of making antisemitic remarks, to campus, according to the school.
Queens College told The National Desk (TND) several school officials attended the lecture "as observers."
“This involvement by a high-ranking college official underscores a much larger issue within Queens College.”When reached for comment, a Queens College representative shared the statement school president Frank Wu sent to students ahead of the February address.
“Speakers do not by such invitation represent the views of the college, as this speaker clearly does not.”The college has been scrutinized for antisemitic acts on its campus in the past.
event_breakdown:
There are several current events of antisemitism reported in the article that can be placed on a map:
- Queens College in New York City: A Queens College student club invited Daniel Haqiqatjou, who has a history of making antisemitic remarks, to campus in February, and multiple school officials attended the event as observers.
- Queens College in New York City: Queens College has been scrutinized for antisemitic acts on its campus in the past.

title: Pro - Hamas Activist Declares :  We Dont Want Zionists In Palestine , NYC , Our Schools , On The Train , Anywhere
message:
The founder of a radical anti-Israel, pro-Hamas activist group said she does not want Zionists “anywhere” in the world while speaking in defense of a person who called for “Zionists” to leave a crowded subway car in New York City.
Nerdeen Kiswani, the founder of Within Our Lifetime, wrote on Twitter/X on Thursday that “We don’t want zionists in Palestine, NYC, our schools, on the train, ANYWHERE.”“This is free speech,” she continued, “it is saying we don’t want racists here.”Zionism refers to the belief that there should be a Jewish state in some part of the land of Israel.
On October 8, her organization organized a protest to celebrate the prior day’s attack.
The protest included several instances of antisemitism, prompting widespread condemnation, including from US President Joe Biden and progressive members of Congress.
Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez wrote on Twitter/X “The callousness, dehumanization, and targeting of Jews on display at last night’s protest outside the Nova Festival exhibit was atrocious antisemitism – plain and simple.”
event_breakdown:
Target event:
Anti-Israel activist Nerdeen Kiswani states that Zionists should not be allowed anywhere.

title: Trump says Israel must  finish the job  in Gaza , makes false charge regarding October 7  denier – NaturalNews . com
message:

They have to finish it quickly, strongly, and they have to get back to life again, because it’s taking too long.”He then goes on to complain that the October 7 Hamas attack is “getting more and more demeaned.
Israeli government’s horrific claims regarding Oct. 7 debunked by Israeli media themselvesYet after extensive investigations, Jewish Israeli news outlets themselves have debunked both of these claims and more.
